{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the effect of fluoride on teeth development. From the documents, it is clear that fluoride affects the teeth that are developing during the time of exposure. In this case, the child was exposed to high fluoride levels for the first 8 years of their life. According to general dental development timelines, during the first 8 years, a child develops all their primary teeth and starts developing some of their permanent teeth, specifically the first molars and incisors. Therefore, the teeth affected would be all primary teeth and the first permanent molars and incisors.", "answer_choice": "A. All primary teeth"}
